_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

                                                          Meeder Equipment Company


1. FACILITY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE POLICY


The owners, management, and the employees of Meeder Equipment Company are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of propane.  If an accidental release should occur, the company is prepared to notify and work with the local responders, of other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.  A detailed emergency response plan has been developed and would be implemented by the facility management in the event of an accidental release of our product.

2 FACILITY INFORMATION


The primary business of the facility is the storage and distribution of liquefied petroleum gas (propane) access to the site is restricted to authorized personnel. This facility was determined to meet the RMP program (3) criteria.


3.  ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM

This facility complies with EPA'S accident prevention rule and all applicable federal, state, and local codes and regulations.  The propane system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA-58 and state law and the uniform fire code standard 82.

4. WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO

Failure of the largest storage tank when filled to the greatest amount (85 %) at (60 deg f) would result in a vapor cloud explosion.  It is assumed that the entire tank contents are released as a vapor, which finds an ignition source. 10 percent of the release quantity is assumed to participate in a resulting explosion.  The endpoint used is 1-PSI OVERPRESSURE. According to EPAA?S reference tables or equations, the distance to the endpoint is .40 miles. There is an estimated residential population of  500 people within the distance to the endpoint.

5. FIVE - YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORIES

There have been no accidental releases or accidents involving propane in the pa

st five years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility, or caused any off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.





6.  EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

In the event of an emergency involving our propane system, it is our policy to notify the local fire department, or other authorities, to request a response to the emergency.  We have discussed this policy with the local fire department, or other authorities, to coordinate such a response.

7.  PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Safety is an on- going process at the facility and the periodic evaluations are preformed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions.  Employees at the facility receive training on safety, proper loading and unloading procedures, and of the emergency shut-off switches/ valves and procedures for closing such switches/ valves in the event of an accidental release of propane.
